page.title: 09The Life of an 'Army' Wife
page.content: We spoke to a very friendly group of young wives from Bulford Camp.Most of them enjoyed the frequent moves, every two or three years, but saw problems ahead with their children's education. They said that despite the moves they were able to maintain friendships as most units moved together. During their husband's many absences on exercises the childless wives tended to go back to the family home, whilst those with children stayed on Camp. Two complaints were predominant, the smallness of married quarters and the distance from the nearest big shopping town, Salisbury. There is a good regular bus service, but as the cost per adult is Â£2 return, most found it too expensive to make frequent visits. The shopping facilities at Bulford were thought to be adequate.
